tool_description:
A one-stop crypto API developed by TokenInsight (tokeninsight.com)that helps you get:
1. crypto prices, trading markets, ratings, contract addresses, ecosystems, etc. 
2. Exchanges volume, and historical data. 
3. General market statistics of the cryptocurrencies market.
4. Latest crypto news and research reports.
5. More endpoint here https://tokeninsight-api.readme.io/reference/api-overview

Check here to see how to get your Free API Key https://tokeninsight-api.readme.io/reference/get-your...
name: TokenInsight Crypto API
title: TokenInsight Crypto API

api_list.name: Exchange historical data
api_list.description:
Retrieve crypto exchanges historical data including spot volume, derivatives volume and total volume.
https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges/binance

api_list.name: Coin historical data
api_list.description:
Retrieve coins historical data including price, market cap, and trading volume. Day, Hour, and Minute data is supported.

https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/bitcoin/historical

optional_parameters.name: interval
optional_parameters.description: minute, hour, day. day in default

optional_parameters.name: length
optional_parameters.description: minute: 1-10080(60 in default) hour: 1-8784(24 in default) day: 1-365, -1 stands for max (90 in default)

api_list.name: All coins rating
Any coin rating
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/rating/coin/ethereum"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/rating/coin/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: CRYPTO RESEARCH ARTICLES
api_list.description:
Retrieve the latest research articles.

https://tokeninsight.com/en/research

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description: 'en' for English research articles and 'cn' for Chinese research articles.

api_list.name: CRYPTO NEWS
api_list.description:
Return the latest crypto-related news

https://tokeninsight.com/en/news

optional_parameters.name: lang
optional_parameters.description: 'en' for English news, 'cn' for Chinese news, and 'kr' for Korea news.

api_list.name: Exchange trading markets

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Exchange id, exid. You can find all exchange id in the exchanges list endpoint.

api_list.name: Exchange complete data

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Exchange ID, exid. You can find the exid in the exchange list for every exchange.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/exchanges/binance"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/exchanges/{id}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Exchanges list
api_list.description:
Use `offset` and `limit` to decide the number of items (in this case, the number of exchanges) that will be returned.

For example, set `offset` as `0`, and `limit` as `20`, then you will get the top 20 exchanges data based on exchanges' ranking on https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges.

Set `offset` as `10`, and limit as `10`, then you will get 10 exchanges data from No.11 to No.20 based on exchanges' ranking on https://tokeninsight.com/en/exchanges.

optional_parameters.name: derivatives
optional_parameters.description: true/false to include derivatives exchanges, default: false

optional_parameters.name: cex
optional_parameters.description: true/false to include centralized exchanges, default: true

optional_parameters.name: dex
optional_parameters.description: true/false to include decentralized exchanges, default: false

optional_parameters.name: spot
optional_parameters.description: true/false to include spot exchanges, default: true

api_list.name: Newly listed coins
api_list.description:
You are able to retrieve the latest listed tokens on TokenInsight.

https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies/newly-listed

You can use `price_tracked` to filter whether tokens without prices are included.

optional_parameters.name: price_tracked
optional_parameters.description: true stands for yes, and newly listed token with prices will be excluded. false stands for no and all the newly listed tokens will be returned

api_list.name: Top losers
api_list.description:
https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies/gainers-losers

You will be able to retrieve the top gainer list with this endpoint.

The parameter you set range controls the `range` that top gainers you get from.

`100` stands for you are retrieving the top gainers within the Top 100 tokens by market cap.

`200` stands for you are retrieving the top gainers within the Top 200 tokens by market cap.

optional_parameters.name: range
optional_parameters.description: Gainers or losers in top *** coins. Ex: 100 stands for retrieving ganers / losers in only the top 100 marketcap coins. 500 stands for for retrieving ganers / losers in only the top 500 marketcap coins. Default in 100, other options 200 500 1000 and -1 .-1 stands for the whole token range

api_list.name: Top gainers
api_list.description:
https://tokeninsight.com/en/cryptocurrencies/gainers-losers

You will be able to retrieve the top gainer list with this endpoint.

The parameter you set `range` controls the range that top gainers you get from.

`100` stands for you are retrieving the top gainers within the Top 100 tokens by market cap.

`200` stands for you are retrieving the top gainers within the Top 200 tokens by market cap.

optional_parameters.name: range
optional_parameters.description: Gainers or losers in top *** coins. Ex: 100 stands for retrieving ganers / losers in only the top 100 marketcap coins. 500 stands for for retrieving ganers / losers in only the top 500 marketcap coins. Default in 100, other options 200 500 1000 and -1 .-1 stands for the whole token range

api_list.name: Coin trading markets

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: A unique ID to identify different coins/protocols. You can find the list of ids in Coins list endpoint.

api_list.name: Coin complete data

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: A unique ID to identify different coins/protocols. You can find the list of ids in Coins list endpoint.

api_list.name: Coins list
api_list.description:
Retrieve coins list with price.
Get all coins with prices that are currently listed on TokenInsight. Price is the default in US Dollars. You can check Get list of supported_vs_currencies for other currencies.

id is unique to any given coin / protocol. You shall need it if you want to retrieve data on a specific coin. We have more than 10k+ coins in our database, thus, more than 10k ids.

Most of the time, TokenInsight's coin id was the same as their name, while replacing space or other symbols with a "-".

You can also find a coin's id from our website's URL:
https://tokeninsight.com/en/coins/bitcoin/overview

bitcoin that after "coins/" is the coin id.

Use offset and limit to decide the number of items (in this case, the number of coins) that will be returned.

For example, set offset as 0, and limit as 200, then you will get the top 200 coins based on the coins' marketcap.

Set offset as 200, and limit as 50, then you will get 50 coins from No.201 to No.250 based on the coins' marketcap.

api_list.name: Currencies supported
api_list.code:

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Coin simple data

required_parameters.name: ids
required_parameters.description: A unique ID to identify different coins/protocols. You can find the list of ids in Coin list endpoint. Comma-separated if querying more than 1 coin

optional_parameters.name: include_vol_spot_24h
optional_parameters.description: true/false to include 24h spot_vol, default: false

optional_parameters.name: include_price_change_percentage_24h
optional_parameters.description: true/false to include 24h price change percentage., default: false

optional_parameters.name: include_market_cap
optional_parameters.description: true/false to include market_cap, default: false

optional_parameters.name: vs_currencies
optional_parameters.description: vs_currency of coins, comma-separated if querying more than 1 vs_currency. Default in USD

api_list.name: GLOBAL STATUS
api_list.description: Retrieve the global status of the crypto market, including global market cap, trading volume, top coins' dominance, and other metrics.
api_list.code:

url = "https://tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/global"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "tokeninsight-crypto-api1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
